title: GUIDE TO TRACTOR PALLET FORKS.  WHAT SIZE PALLET FORKS?

tasks.task: Guide on selecting the right set of pallet forks for tractors
subtasks: Explain pallet fork selection for tractors (e.g., John Deere, Kubota)
Demonstrate proper quick attach installation (e.g., John Deere Quick Attits, Skid Steer Quick Attchs)
Compare weight capacities and uses of different pallet forks (e.g., 900, 2000, 4200, 5500-pound ratings)
Discuss safety considerations (e.g., counterweight, ballast weight, quick hitch brackets)
Explore various pallet fork types (e.g., hydraulic, ultralight, standard duty)
Address common troubleshooting tips (e.g., heat expansion, quick coupler problems)
Highlight features and benefits of pallet fork extensions (compatibility, extendable reach)

tasks.task: Overview of pallet forks uses and maintenance
subtasks: Discuss various applications of pallet forks (e.g., moving logs, brush piles, furniture, posts, boulders)
Explain maintenance and safety checks for pallet forks (e.g., check pins, ensure secure attachment)

tasks.task: Explanation of tine length and weight considerations
subtasks: Compare different tine lengths (36, 42, 48 inches) and their weight capacity impact
Advise on appropriate tine length for various tractors (e.g., subcompact vs. large frame)
Discuss considerations for storing and shipping pallet forks (e.g., fork extensions for longer reach)

tasks.task: Product recommendations and codes (e.g., HLA products, Bora Wheel Spacers, palletforks.com)
subtasks: Mention product sponsors and discount codes (e.g., "GWT" code for 5% off)
Provide links for product purchases (e.g., HLA forks, Bora Wheel Spacers, palletforks.com)
